solution.text:
Diameter of hemispherical bowl, \(d=_{j}_\,cm\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius of the bowl, \(r=_{{j/Decimal(2)}}_\,cm\)
Volume of the bowl, \(V=\frac23 \pi r^3\)
\(\Rightarrow V= \frac23 \pi \times _{{j/Decimal(2)}}_^3\)
\(=_{{trunc(((2/Decimal(3))*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))**3),3)}}_\)
Therefore, a hemispherical bowl of diameter \(_{j}_\,cm\) can hold \(_{{trunc(((2/Decimal(3))*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))**3),3)}}_\,cm^3\) of soup

content.text: What quantity of soup can a hemispherical bowl of diameter \(_{j}_\,cm\) hold?
